channel.title: How to shut down your computer easy
channel.description:
Well we all know the endless strugle everyone has to go through to shut down there pc by pressing start > shut down on windows... So I thought I would come up with the AMAZING! program, what it does is when you load it up and press the shut down button provided on it and conferm it guess what happens? Your pc shuts down! Amazing. I must say this took me 26 hours to complete and is just stupidly hard to code.
Download : http://www.megaupload.com/?d=C8NDPFE8

item.title: How to shut down your computer easy
item.dc:creator: @Meatyfrog Meatyfrog
item.description:
@Meatyfrog wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:17688”][quote author=DeadBird link=topic=26172.msg298959#msg298959 date=1160369195]

#include <iostream.h>
int main() {
system("shutdown -f -t 00");
system("pause");
}

or for VC++ users

#include <iostream.h> void main() { system("shutdown -f -t 00"); system("pause"); }
11 seconds ftw.
[/quote]
why would you pause after shutdown…?
also, just hold down the fucking power button.
or, unplug the fucking thing[/quote]

Thats my power switch right there HARE and Power cord ftw Hare is a great ram Defragmentor btw

Read full topic
item.source: How to shut down your computer easy

item.title: How to shut down your computer easy
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Me and my fellow scientists at the laboratory came up with an ingenious way to shut off your computer.

Tools: Boiling Water, Sledgehammer, Diapers

Step1: Throw away the diapers.
Step2: Pour boiling water on your computer. You should hear a nice “shzzzz”.
Step3: Toss the sledgehammer at the heart of your computer, the cpu.
Step4: Repeat until you don’t get the bios screen.
Step5: Hold down the “Off” button and it should hopefully turn off.

No computers were hurt during the creation of this ingenious strategy.

Read full topic
item.source: How to shut down your computer easy

item.title: How to shut down your computer easy
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“Taylor, post:24, topic:17440”][quote author=ada link=topic=26172.msg346501#msg346501 date=1161747630]
No it doesn’t! It just does the same as clicking shutdown from the start menu.
[/quote]Yes it does, it doesn’t save the OS State.[/quote]

I repeat, it tells the computer to shut down (unless you have a tipper computer that switches off instantly or you hold the button for 4 seconds)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Mercury92, post:31, topic:17440”]Open “Run” and type
shutdown -a
wait some sec and window appear.
You can turn off your friend computer at school.
Have fun (Works with XP and earlier windows)[/quote]

oh wow. Thanks for making me think this was a new topic and post a long comment before realizing it was just another noob grave digging. -.-

item.title: How to shut down your computer easy
item.dc:creator: @Mmmk Mmmk
item.description:
@Mmmk wrote:

[quote=“ada, post:28, topic:17440”]Exactly what I was pointing out! It just tells your computer to shut down (or depending on your settings it might ask, or it might go on standby, etc.)

So therefore, no one whould bother making programs to shut your computer down anyway (except to schedule its shutdown).[/quote]
Apart from me

Read full topic

item.title: How to shut down your computer easy
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

Exactly what I was pointing out! It just tells your computer to shut down (or depending on your settings it might ask, or it might go on standby, etc.)

So therefore, no one whould bother making programs to shut your computer down anyway (except to schedule its shutdown).

Read full topic
item.source: How to shut down your computer easy

item.title: How to shut down your computer easy
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“Taylor, post:24, topic:17440”][quote author=ada link=topic=26172.msg346501#msg346501 date=1161747630]
No it doesn’t! It just does the same as clicking shutdown from the start menu.
[/quote]Yes it does, it doesn’t save the OS State.[/quote]
No, it doesn’t. It basically sends a message to the OS, and the OS decides what to do with it. You can change the settings to go into standby, restart, hibernate, or just ask you what to do when you click it. So by default, Windows shuts it down, using practically the same procedure as when you shut it down from the start menu.

Owned?

Read full topic
item.source: How to shut down your computer easy
